com.github.farhan3.jclickerquiz.model

Class Question

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.farhan3.jclickerquiz.model.Question

  • public class Question
extends java.lang.Object
    A Question object is created by specifying the number of choices available to the students. The number of choices can be 2, 3, 4, or 5. The answer provided by a specific student can then be added. You can also obtain a list of students who have answered the question.
    Author:
    farhan

      • Question

        public Question(int numOfChoices)
         throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        A Question object is created by specifying the number of choices available to the students. The number of choices can be 2, 3, 4, or 5.
        Parameters:

        Throws:

    • Method Detail

      • logAnswer

        public boolean logAnswer(java.lang.Integer studentNum,
                         Option option)
        Log a student's answer
        Parameters:
        studentNum - student number of the student
        option - the option chosen by the student; this value should not be more than the number of choices this question allows
        Returns:
        true if the student's option was successfully logged, false otherwise

      • getStudentsAnswer

        public Option getStudentsAnswer(java.lang.Integer studentNum)
        Get the option chosen by the student with the specified student number
        Parameters:
        studentNum - the student's number
        Returns:
        the student's entered option or null if there was no option logged for the student

      • setQuestionString

        Associate a String with this question
        Note: this field is optional
        Parameters:
        questionString - the String to associate with the question

      • getQuestionString

        public java.lang.String getQuestionString()
        Get the String associated with the question
        Returns:
